commands.Name: BOA-APP-DATA
commands.Extra:
examples: 
	proptag <command> will use stdin and stdout
	proptag <command> -o a b -- -s c d  will use a and b for outputs and c and d for input.  
	proptag <command> -o a b will cause a and b to be interpreted as output file and 
	stdin as input.
	proptag [enter] will display this help text and exit
	
	using tags:		
	proptag will read go source files and generate getters and setters
	for variables that are tagged with a tag of the proper format.  
	These tags can be set on package level variables or inside structs
	on fields.  If placed on fields the functions will be generated as
	methods on the containing struct, otherwise as stand-alone exported
	functions.  Tags can be, and usually are, placed at the end of the
	line to be operated on.  In this case the one-liner format is
	required.  This tag consists of the opening bracket '<' then the 
	tag string starting with 'p'.  If the property is to be assigned 
	and its type cannot or will not be assigned using the assignment
	operator, then uppercase S can be used in the tag string to
	cause an assignment via a user implemented Set method.

commands.Name: help
commands.ShortHelp: Show help and exit, default command

commands.Name: comment
commands.ShortHelp: Comment out the region enclosed in the tag

commands.Name: uncomment
commands.ShortHelp: Uncomment out the region enclosed in the tag

commands.Name: extract
commands.ShortHelp: Copy the region to a file
commands.LongHelp:
Copies the text enclosed in the region tag(s) to the save destination
The source stays unchanged

commands.Name: cut
commands.ShortHelp: Cut the region from the source and save to another file

commands.Name: delete
commands.ShortHelp: Delete the tag from the source
commands.LongHelp:
Deletes the tag itself from the source file
This does not delete any other text in the source

commands.Name: list
commands.ShortHelp: Generate a report listing the file and line number of the region tags in the input

commands.Name: --copy
commands.ShortHelp: File path to save original to
commands.LongHelp:
This flag is used as a safety net for operations that change the source file
like cut, delete, comment, uncomment

commands.Name: --source
commands.ShortHelp: Source files to read and process
commands.LongHelp:
More than one file path can be passed for the list command
because it does not operate on a specific tag. Multiple sources
can be read and a report generated.  The other commands do
operate on specific tag(s) and will only read the first file passed
on the command line

commands.Name: --mock
commands.ShortHelp: Sends output to terminal and leaves input unchanged

commands.Name: --tag
commands.ShortHelp: Tags to process. Required for every command except list and help
